metadata.dc:author: Thompson, L
Castrillón, M
Zamboni, R
Arriagada, P
Oddó, D
Sepúlveda, C
metadata.dc:description: We report a 28 year old heterosexual male with AIDS that presented with progressive motor disturbances and malaise. Light and transmission electron microscopy of a stereotaxic brain biopsy demonstrated a progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy. This is a demyelinating infectious cerebral disease attributed to JC virus and must be considered in the differential diagnosis of central nervous system disturbances in AIDS patients.
metadata.dc:title: Leucoencefalopatía multifocal progresiva en un paciente con síndrome de inmunodeficiencia adquirida.
[Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy in a patient with acquired immunodeficiency syndrome].
